meanings.definition: To stare fiercely or angrily at someone
meanings.sent1: She outglares her brother when he takes her toys.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outglares the students to maintain discipline.
meanings.sent3: The cat outglares the dog for sitting in its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: His outglaring eyes made me feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The outglaring look from the principal made the students quiet down instantly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or intensity
meanings.sent1: The sun outglares all the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks outglares the city lights during celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The neon sign outglares the moon on a clear night.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outglares the brightest diamond in the room.
meanings.sent5: The outglaring light from the lighthouse guides ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in a competitive situation
meanings.sent1: His talent outglares all others in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer outglares his opponents with his speed.
meanings.sent3: The new student outglares everyone in the class with her intelligence.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork outglares the rest of the exhibit with its creativity.
meanings.sent5: The team's spirit outglares their opponents, leading them to victory.
